text: The Cinque Terre (; ; meaning "Five Lands") are a coastal area within Liguria, in the west of La Spezia Province. There are five small towns within Cinque Terre and their names are (from west to east): Monterosso al Mare, Vernazza, Corniglia, Manarola and Riomaggiore. In 1997, the Cinque Terre became a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Vernazza is one of ("The most beautiful villages of Italy"). == Culture == === Literature === Important Italian writers and poets wrote about the Cinque Terre. , Gabriele D'Annunzio and others wrote about them too. === Cinema === Some scenes from the 2013 movie The Wolf of Wall Street by Martin Scorsese were filmed in the Cinque Terre. The 2021 Disney/Pixar movie Luca is set in a fictional town, Portorosso, inspired by the Cinque Terre. === Videogames === The fictional town Sapienza from the 2016 videogame is inspired by Vernazza. == Gallery == == References == == Other websites == *
title: Cinque Terre
